intro: Ononis natrix var. hidumensis, commonly known as the Hidumensian sandspurry, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. This variety is often found in disturbed or coastal habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
